title: The Old Man and the Sea
overall_context: An aging fisherman named Santiago struggles with a giant marlin far out in the Gulf Stream.

story_components.description: Santiago has gone 84 days without catching a fish, considered unlucky, and is alone as Manolin can no longer fish with him.

story_components.description: Santiago sets out to sea, determined and hopeful to break his unlucky streak, feeling a deep connection with the sea.

story_components.description: Santiago hooks a marlin, leading to a grueling struggle that tests his strength, skill, and resilience.
After an intense battle, Santiago finally kills the marlin, feeling a mix of triumph and exhaustion.
Santiago fights off sharks, but they mutilate the marlin, and he loses his harpoon, knife, and club in the process.
Defeated by the relentless sharks, Santiago loses the marlin's flesh and returns to shore with only the skeleton.
Santiago is found by Manolin, who expresses admiration and love, promising to fish together again, restoring Santiago's spirit.
